com.nexmo.sdk

Class NexmoClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nexmo.sdk.NexmoClient

  • public class NexmoClient
extends java.lang.Object
    The NexmoClient is the Nexmo SDK entry point. It provides access to the Verify mechanism acquired through a VerifyClient object. For the security of your Nexmo account, you should not embed your sharedSecretKey or your Nexmo authorization token as strings in the app you submit to the Google Play Store.

    To construct a NexmoClient, the required parameters are:

    • applicationContext: The application context.
    • sharedSecretKey: The pre-shared secret key generated by Nexmo, visible in your user Dashboard. This key is unique for each application registered to use the Number SDK service.
    • applicationId: The auto-generated id for the application.
    If the required parameters for creating a NexmoClient instance are not supplied, then NexmoClient.NexmoClientBuilder.build() fails by throwing a ClientBuilderException exception.

    Example usage: 

         try{
         // Create a NexmoClient using the NexmoClientBuilder.
         NexmoClient myNexmoClient = new NexmoClient.NexmoClientBuilder()
                                      .context(myAppContext)
                                      .sharedSecretKey("...")
                                      .applicationId("...")
                                      .build();
     } catch (ClientBuilderException e) {
         e.printStackTrace();
     }

      Nested Classes

      static class  NexmoClient.ENVIRONMENT_HOST
      Environment endpoint: production or sandbox.
      static class  NexmoClient.NexmoClientBuilder
      Build a new NexmoClient instance, based on the following mandatory parameters: applicationContext: The application context. sharedSecretKey: The pre-shared secret key generated by Nexmo, visible in your user Dashboard.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from class: java.lang.Object
        Returns a string containing a concise, human-readable description of this object. Subclasses are encouraged to override this method and provide an implementation that takes into account the object's type and data. The default implementation is equivalent to the following expression: 
           getClass().getName() + '@' + Integer.toHexString(hashCode())

        See Writing a useful toString method if you intend implementing your own toString method.
